title: [SETUP-BUG] Error while installing MLflow in RStudio with install_mlflow
body:
### System information
- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**: Windows Server 2016
- **MLflow installed from (source or binary)**: From RStudio using "install.packages('mlflow')"
- **MLflow version (run ``mlflow --version``)**: 1.2.0
- **Python version**: 3.6.3
- **Exact command to reproduce**: mlflow::install_mlflow()

### Describe the problem
After the r-mlflow-1.2.0 Python environment is created, I get the error:

'"C:\Program"' is not recognized as an internal or external command,
operable program or batch file.

### Other info / logs
Anaconda3 is installed on my system.
I'm using R 3.6.0 64-bit.
After executing `install_mlflow()`, I get the following log in the console:

```
Collecting package metadata (repodata.json): ...working... done
Solving environment: ...working... done


==> WARNING: A newer version of conda exists. <==
  current version: 4.7.11
  latest version: 4.7.12

Please update conda by running

    $ conda update -n base -c defaults conda



## Package Plan ##

  environment location: C:\PROGRA~3\ANACON~1\envs\r-mlflow-1.2.0

  added / updated specs:
    - python=3.6


The following packages will be downloaded:

    package                    |            build
    ---------------------------|-----------------
    certifi-2019.6.16          |           py36_1         156 KB
    pip-19.2.2                 |           py36_0         1.9 MB
    python-3.6.9               |       h5500b2f_0        20.4 MB
    setuptools-41.0.1          |           py36_0         663 KB
    wheel-0.33.4               |           py36_0          57 KB
    wincertstore-0.2           |   py36h7fe50ca_0          13 KB
    ------------------------------------------------------------
                                           Total:        23.2 MB

The following NEW packages will be INSTALLED:

  certifi            pkgs/main/win-64::certifi-2019.6.16-py36_1
  pip                pkgs/main/win-64::pip-19.2.2-py36_0
  python             pkgs/main/win-64::python-3.6.9-h5500b2f_0
  setuptools         pkgs/main/win-64::setuptools-41.0.1-py36_0
  sqlite             pkgs/main/win-64::sqlite-3.29.0-he774522_0
  vc                 pkgs/main/win-64::vc-14.1-h0510ff6_4
  vs2015_runtime     pkgs/main/win-64::vs2015_runtime-14.16.27012-hf0eaf9b_0
  wheel              pkgs/main/win-64::wheel-0.33.4-py36_0
  wincertstore       pkgs/main/win-64::wincertstore-0.2-py36h7fe50ca_0



Downloading and Extracting Packages
wincertstore-0.2     | 13 KB     | ########## | 100% 
setuptools-41.0.1    | 663 KB    | ########## | 100% 
wheel-0.33.4         | 57 KB     | ########## | 100% 
pip-19.2.2           | 1.9 MB    | ########## | 100% 
python-3.6.9         | 20.4 MB   | ########## | 100% 
certifi-2019.6.16    | 156 KB    | ########## | 100% 
Preparing transaction: ...working... done
Verifying transaction: ...working... done
Executing transaction: ...working... done
#
# To activate this environment, use
#
#     $ conda activate r-mlflow-1.2.0
#
# To deactivate an active environment, use
#
#     $ conda deactivate


C:\Users\Administrator\Documents>conda.bat activate r-mlflow-1.2.0 
'"C:\Program"' is not recognized as an internal or external command,
operable program or batch file.
Could Not Find C:\Program
'pip' is not recognized as an internal or external command,
operable program or batch file.
Error: Error 1 occurred installing packages into conda environment r-mlflow-1.2.0
```

--------
 EDIT 1
--------
I can reproduce the error with this code:

```
conda = reticulate::conda_binary(conda = "auto")
reticulate::conda_install('mlflow==1.2.0', envname = 'r-mlflow-1.2.0', pip = TRUE, conda = conda)
```

So it seems a reticulate bug in quoting windows paths with spaces.
I've just opened an [issue](https://github.com/rstudio/reticulate/issues/596) in reticulate repo.
